keyTakeAways: Christopher Moynihan, a former Capitol rioter, was pardoned by President Trump after the January 6, 2021 attack.
Moynihan was arrested in October 2025 on a charge of making a terroristic threat against U.S. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries.
The arrest stemmed from text messages allegedly sent by Moynihan in which he threatened to kill Jeffries, including the message: 'I will kill him for the future.'
Moynihan had previously been sentenced to 21 months in prison and 36 months of supervised release in 2023.
His pardon was part of a broader blanket pardon issued by President Trump that included over 1,500 individuals charged in connection with the Capitol riot.
The incident reflects growing concern among law enforcement and lawmakers about the reoffending of individuals pardoned for Capitol riot-related crimes.
Capitol Police reported a significant increase in threat assessments, with approximately 14,000 cases expected by the end of 2025, indicating a rise in threats to elected officials.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Christopher Moynihan, a 34-year-old man who participated in the January 6, 2021 Capitol riot, was pardoned by President Trump as part of a blanket pardon issued to over 1,500 individuals involved in the attack. In October 2025, he was arrested on a felony charge of making a terroristic threat against U.S. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, after allegedly texting messages threatening to kill him, including 'I will kill him for the future.' Moynihan, who had previously been sentenced to 21 months in prison and 36 months of supervised release, is now facing charges related to these threats. His arrest comes amid rising concerns from law enforcement about the reoffending of individuals pardoned for Capitol riot-related crimes, with Capitol Police reporting a dramatic increase in threat assessments to lawmakers. This case underscores broader debates over the effectiveness and consequences of blanket pardons for violent acts committed during politically charged events.
title: Pardoned Capitol rioter arrested for allegedly threatening to kill Hakeem Jeffries
